page.title: 11OLD MIDDLETON CUSTOMS
page.content: {Customs that have died out {Mock Mayor Making-}was a custom where ladies chose a stranger dressed in rags to go to every inn on a cart and ask for a drink; if he didn't get it he had a fight. He got very drunk. { {Hag Man Heigh-}The Hag man was the woodman and he went round the town on New Years Eve, knocking on doors singing his special song. { {Rush Bearing-}Rushes were built into a kind of pyramid on a rush cart that was ornimented at the front and surmounted by a garland, and hauled along by men to the Parish Church. A prize was given for best cart. The rushes were laid on the church floor for warmth. { {Clog Fights-}Men wore pointed clogs which they used to kick each other until one shouted "Enough!"
